com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface AttributeValue<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the java type of the object representing the value of the XACML AttributeValue element.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DOMAttributeValue, JaxpAttributeValue, StdAttributeValue

    public interface AttributeValue<T>
    Defines the API for objects representing XACML AttributeValue elements.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the AttributeValue interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two AttributeValues (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getDataTypeId().equals(a2.getDataTypeId()) AND a1.getValue() == null && a2.getValue() == null OR a1.getValue().equals(a2.getValue())
      Identifier getDataTypeId()
      Returns the Identifier representing the XACML data type of this AttributeValue.
      T getValue()
      Returns the object representing the value of the XACML AttributeValue element represented by thisAttributeValue of type T.
      Identifier getXPathCategory()
      Returns the Identifier representing the XACML Category id of this AttributeValue for AttributeValues of the data type XPathExpression.

        Identifier getXPathCategory()
        Returns the Identifier representing the XACML Category id of this AttributeValue for AttributeValues of the data type XPathExpression.

        the Identifier representing the XACML Category id of this AttributeValue.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implementations of the AttributeValue interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two AttributeValues (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getDataTypeId().equals(a2.getDataTypeId()) AND a1.getValue() == null && a2.getValue() == null OR a1.getValue().equals(a2.getValue())
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
